alert.note: Alert for Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 11 at 4:06AM EDT by NWS Key West
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Florida, including the following counties, Upper Keys in Monroe County and Middle Keys in Monroe County. * WHEN...Until 715 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 406 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marathon, West End Of Channel 5 Bridge, Channel 5 Bridge, East End Of Channel 5 Bridge, East End Of Long Key Viaduct, Long Key Viaduct, West End Of Long Key Viaduct, East End Of Seven Mile Bridge, Key Largo and Plantation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. If you observe flooding, contact your Key West National Weather Service office at 3 0 5...295...1 3 1 6...extension 3.
